thread.title: Report: Thorns finalizing trade to send Alex Morgan to Orlando
thread.title_full: Report: Thorns finalizing trade to send Alex Morgan to Orlando

title: Report: Thorns finalizing trade to send Alex Morgan to Orlando
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Report: Thorns finalizing trade to send Alex Morgan to Orlando The Portland Thorns are finalizing a trade that would send Alex Morgan to the league’s new NWSL expansion team in Orlando, Sports Illustrated reported. Post to Facebook Report: Thorns finalizing trade to send Alex Morgan to Orlando The Portland Thorns are finalizing a trade that would send Alex Morgan to the league’s new NWSL expansion team in Orlando, Sports Illustrated reported. Check out this story on KGW.com: http://on.kgw.com/1LMVmhy Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Report: Thorns finalizing trade to send Alex Morgan to Orlando KGW.com Staff 5:39 p.m. PDT October 21, 2015 Forward Alex Morgan #13 of USA against Mexico during the second half of an International Friendly at RFK Stadium. (Photo: Patrick Smith, Getty Images) 
PORTLAND, Ore. – The Portland Thorns are finalizing a trade that would send Alex Morgan to the National Women's Soccer League expansion team in Orlando, Sports Illustrated reported . 
The trade will be completed in the next few days, according to SI’s Grant Wahl. 
Morgan reportedly requested a trade so she could be closer to her husband, Servando Carrasco, who plays for Orlando City SC of Major League Soccer. 
“According to sources with knowledge of the deal, Portland would not have agreed to trade Morgan unless she had made her request for personal reasons,” Wahl said. 
Portland would receive Orlando’s first pick in the NWSL draft, two international slots, and will likely receive U.S. national team fullback Meghan Klingenberg.
